channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Is buyout culture in college football getting out of hand?
item.description: James Franklin has been fired as the coach of Penn State's football team. He'll get a buyout of almost $50 million, reflecting a trend of coaches getting large golden parachutes.
item.content:encoded: James Franklin has been fired as the coach of Penn State's football team. He'll get a buyout of almost $50 million, reflecting a trend of coaches getting large golden parachutes.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: Diane Keaton moved with grace through dozens of character arcs, and into audience hearts
item.description: Many of the headlines marking the passing of actress Diane Keaton this weekend have mentioned Annie Hall, the film that earned her an Oscar and made her a distinctively haphazard fashion icon. But there was always more to her, and audiences sensed that.
item.content:encoded: Many of the headlines marking the passing of actress Diane Keaton this weekend have mentioned Annie Hall, the film that earned her an Oscar and made her a distinctively haphazard fashion icon. But there was always more to her, and audiences sensed that.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: A family-owned Asian grocery store in Florida struggles to stay afloat as costs rise
item.description: An Asian Grocery store in Florida may have to close after more than 40 years in operation, in part due to new import tariffs.
item.content:encoded: An Asian Grocery store in Florida may have to close after more than 40 years in operation, in part due to new import tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Nancy Guan

item.title: A stunning discovery in Mongolia changes what's known about domed-head dinosaurs
item.description: The pachycephalosaurs were a unique group of dinosaurs with domed heads. But scientists haven't known much about them because their fossils have been so incomplete. A stunning discovery from southern Mongolia has changed that.
item.content:encoded: The pachycephalosaurs were a unique group of dinosaurs with domed heads. But scientists haven't known much about them because their fossils have been so incomplete. A stunning discovery from southern Mongolia has changed that.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: For decades, there was no physical barrier between U.S. and Mexico, until this battle
item.description: There was no physical barrier between the U.S. and Mexico for decades -- until one critical battle at the border changed it all.
item.content:encoded: There was no physical barrier between the U.S. and Mexico for decades -- until one critical battle at the border changed it all.
item.dc:creator: Anya Steinberg

item.title: Communities are cut off in Mexico amid deadly flooding from 2 tropical storms
item.description: At least 64 people are dead after torrential rains fueled by twin Pacific storms triggered mudslides and severe flooding across five Mexican states.
item.content:encoded: At least 64 people are dead after torrential rains fueled by twin Pacific storms triggered mudslides and severe flooding across five Mexican states.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Trump in Israel, Egypt to mark end of Gaza war as hostages freed
item.description: Twenty hostages are released by Hamas and more than 1,900 Palestinian detainees and prisoners are released by Israel as President Trump visits Israel and Egypt to mark an end to the Gaza war.
item.content:encoded: Twenty hostages are released by Hamas and more than 1,900 Palestinian detainees and prisoners are released by Israel as President Trump visits Israel and Egypt to mark an end to the Gaza war.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Crowds cheer in Gaza, Ramallah as Israel releases Palestinian prisoners
item.description: As part of the ceasefire deal, Israel released nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners on Monday. The majority were detainees and prisoners arrested in Gaza and returned there to a huge celebratory crowd.
item.content:encoded: As part of the ceasefire deal, Israel released nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners on Monday. The majority were detainees and prisoners arrested in Gaza and returned there to a huge celebratory crowd.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Experts on tech innovations' impacts on standards of living earn economics Nobel
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded today two three professors -- two in the U.S. and one in Europe -- for their research on how technology and "creative destruction" fuels economic growth.
item.content:encoded: The Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded today two three professors -- two in the U.S. and one in Europe -- for their research on how technology and "creative destruction" fuels economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A new school opens in Uvalde, Texas, 3 years after Robb Elementary massacre
item.description: In Uvalde, a new school built with security upgrades is opening three years after the Robb Elementary shooting.
item.content:encoded: In Uvalde, a new school built with security upgrades is opening three years after the Robb Elementary shooting.
item.dc:creator: Camille Phillips
